FuncDef: The reset bgp evpn command resets a specified BGP EVPN IPv6 connection. The reset bgp evpn command resets a specified BGP EVPN IPv6 connection. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a BGP EVPN peer IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Indicates BGP multi-instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. If spaces are used, the string must be enclosed in double quotation marks (" ").

ExtraInfo: To reset the BGP EVPN connection of a peer, run the reset bgp evpn command.
